This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=CGWS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-10T16:11:05Z Victoria Higham 2015-03-10T16:08:36+00:00 2015-03-10T16:08:36+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;1df4a8c9.1503 Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...] Charles Woodhead 2015-03-10T14:01:08+00:00 2015-03-10T14:01:08+00:00 Sexual Enjoyment in British Romanticism: Gender and Psychoanalysis, 1753-1835 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;f6528e91.1503 Dear CGWS subscribers,<br><br>We hope this title will be of interest.<br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01D05B3A.A86C8760]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/sexual-enjoyment-in-british-romanticism>Sexual Enjoyment in British Romanticism<br><br>Gender and Psychoanalysis, 1753-1835<br>David Sigler<br>Debates about gender in the British Romantic period often invoked the idea of sexual enjoyment: there was a broad cultural concern about jouissance, the all-engulfing pleasure pertaining to sexual gratification. On one hand, these debates made possible the modern psychological concept of the unconscious - since desire was seen as an uncontrollable force, the unconscious became the repository of disavowed enjoyment and the reason for sexual difference. On the other hand, the tighter regulation of sexual enjoyment made [...] Charlotte Anderson 2015-03-04T12:15:52+00:00 2015-03-04T12:15:52+00:00 Women's Cinema, World Cinema: Projecting Contemporary Feminisms https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;a8a3ed51.1503 Dear CGWS Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Women's Cinema, World Cinema]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/womens-cinema-world-cinema>Women's Cinema, World Cinema<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/womens-cinema-world-cinema><br><br>Projecting Contemporary Feminisms<br>Patricia White<br><br>"Women's Cinema, World Cinema is an exciting book for the connections that Patricia White expertly draws and explicates between text and context, auteur and society, national and global. Her knowledge of the particularities of individual directors and national cinemas is remarkable, as is her familiarity with their relevant histories and critical literatures. Women's Cinema, World Cinema is a major work that will transform how these films and filmmakers are viewed and studied."- B. Ruby [...] Rachel Shand 2015-02-25T11:50:52+00:00 2015-02-25T11:50:52+00:00 Plucked - A History of Hair Removal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;9df560a4.1502 Dear CGWS Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following titles will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Plucked]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/plucked>Plucked<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/plucked><br><br>A History of Hair Removal<br>Rebecca M. Herzig<br><br>"Clamshell razors, lasers, lye depilatories, tweezers, waxes, threading and electrolysis. Humanity has used an impressive array of tools to remove hair. This is, biologically speaking, pretty strange. Most of Earth's mammals possess luxuriant fur. Only one seeks to remove it. Rebecca Herzig's delightful history of hair removal in America helps explain why: smooth skin is a cultural imperative."-The Economist, 7th February 2015 [...] Rachel Shand 2015-02-04T12:14:07+00:00 2015-02-04T12:14:07+00:00 Unbought and Unbossed - Transgressive Black Women, Sexuality, and Representation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;a3db60f7.1502 Dear CGWS Subscribers,<br><br>We hope the following title will be of interest to you.<br><br>[Unbought and Unbossed]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/unbought-and-unbossed>Unbought and Unbossed<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/unbought-and-unbossed><br><br>Transgressive Black Women, Sexuality, and Representation<br>Trimiko Melancon<br>"Trimiko Melancon offers beautiful and complex readings of novels by Toni Morrison, Ann Allen Shockley, Alice Walker, Gayl Jones, and Gloria Naylor while effortlessly synthesizing a generation of scholarship on black sexuality. Unbought and Unbossed is a refreshingly innovative new work destined to become a classic." -Robert F. Reid-Pharr, author of Once You Go Black: Choice, Desire, and the Black American Intellectual<br>"Unbought and Unbossed is an interesting exploration of black female sexual [...] Rachel Shand 2015-01-22T14:39:31+00:00 2015-01-22T14:39:31+00:00 The Case of Mistress Mary Hampson https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;ba66b04c.1501 Dear CGWS subscribers,<br><br>We hope you find this title of interest.<br><br>[The Case of Mistress Mary Hampson]The Case of Mistress Mary Hampson<br><br>Her Story of Marital Abuse and Defiance in Seventeenth-Century England<br>Jessica Malay<br>"What a fantastic text for scholars of early modern women, marriage and marital conflict! We hear the story of a troubled, abusive marriage in Mary Hampson's own words set against Dr. Malay's expert explanation of married women's legal position and its repercussions for notions of marital abuse. A great resource for teachers and students alike."-JoAnne Bailey, Oxford Brookes University<br>"An astonishingly detailed case-study of a troubled [...] Young Lee 2015-01-14T19:34:34+00:00 2015-01-14T19:34:34+00:00 COMING SOON: Boyhood Studies - An Interdisciplinary Journal https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;86921d66.1501 Dear Colleague,<br><br>In the summer of 2015, Berghahn Journals will launch a new journal that we think will be of particular interest to the members of this list: Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal.<br><br>Boyhood Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal is a peer-reviewed journal providing a forum for the discussion of boyhood, young masculinities, and boys\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd lives by exploring the full scale of intricacies, challenges, and legacies that inform male and masculine developments. It is committed to a critical and international scope and solicits both articles and special issue proposals from a variety of research fields. Abstracts of no longer than 250 words<br>should be submitted to events@bera.ac.uk. Please see link for further<br>information and registration:<br><br>https://www.bera.ac.uk/event/gender-sexuality-and-young-people-after-no-outsiders<br><br>and visit the Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/afternooutsiders [...] Kathryn King 2014-10-22T11:50:19+01:00 2014-10-22T11:50:19+01:00 Latest books in Gender Studies from Policy Press https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;7f671bf2.1410 APOLOGIES FOR CROSS-POSTING<br><br>P <http://www.policypress.co.uk/>olicy Press <http://www.policypress.co.uk/><br>at the University of Bristol, a not- for-profit social science publisher,<br>has a list ranging from critical theory through research, teaching, policy<br>and practice to serious non-fiction for a general audience. Some of our<br>latest and forthcoming books on gender issues are listed below. They are<br>all available on our website <http://www.policypress.co.uk/> at 20%<br>discount. You can also sign up to our newsletter<br><http://www.policypress.co.uk/subscribe.asp> to receive 35% discount on all<br>our books. [...] Rachel Shand 2014-10-16T08:31:07+00:00 2014-10-16T08:31:07+00:00 Grandmothers at Work: Juggling Families and Jobs https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;7a47249.1410 [Description: Description: Grandmothers at Work]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/grandmothers-at-work>Grandmothers at Work<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/grandmothers-at-work><br><br>Juggling Families and Jobs<br>Madonna Harrington Meyer<br>"This book is full of insights into the joys, challenges, strains, and costs, often financial, faced by grandmothers who work for pay and provide care for their grandchildren. The voices of the diverse older women who hold these two demanding roles are vivid and compelling. And discussion of policies- both work and family-that would make things easier for all are woven throughout."-Linda Waite, author of Being Together, Working Apart<br>"Because public policy provides relatively little assistance to working parents in the U.S., grandmothers have become an [...] Victoria Higham 2014-10-06T11:25:02+01:00 2014-10-06T11:25:02+01:00 Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - CALL FOR ABSTRACTS https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;d2758006.1410 News from the Morgan Centre for Research into Everyday Lives, University of Manchester<br>Atmospheres, 1-2 July 2015, Call for Abstracts<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdcapturing\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd them. [...] Young Lee 2014-09-15T16:44:22+01:00 2014-09-15T16:44:22+01:00 New Issue: Girlhood Studies (Vol. 7, Issue 2) - A Girl's Education https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;ac6bc878.1409 Dear Colleague,<br><br>We are pleased to announce that the latest issue of Girlhood Studies has been published by Berghahn Journals. This issue of GHS, broadly based, however accidentally, on the theme of a girl\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds education, also includes reviews of two books, both by leading authors in the area of girlhood studies in the US. As this issue of Girlhood Studies goes to press, we are excited to announce that starting with Volume 8, we will be publishing three issues a year instead of two. [...] Charlotte Boyle 2014-09-11T09:17:45+00:00 2014-09-11T09:17:45+00:00 Willful Subjects https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;949ba3e6.1409 Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[Description: Description: cid:image002.jpg@01CFCC24.6CFE2E40]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/willful-subjects>Willful Subjects<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/willful-subjects><br>Sara Ahmed<br>"Willful Subjects is beautifully conceived and expertly conducted, sentence by sentence, suggestion by suggestion [...] Exquisite formulations engage our contemplation and render real intellectual enjoyment. Followers of Ahmed, of which there are many, will not be disappointed. This new instance of razor-sharp thinking powerfully builds upon The Promise of Happiness to look at something usefully slicing through contentment: the scissoring relations between the will and willfulness. More than cutting-edge, this is cutting thought."-Kathryn Bond Stockton, author of The Queer Child, or Growing Sideways in the Twentieth Century<br>"Like her other [...] Charlotte Boyle 2014-09-01T14:41:19+00:00 2014-09-01T14:41:19+00:00 The Tolerance Trap https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;3efcbff8.1409 Apologies for cross posting<br><br>[Description: Description: Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\F01 images\\NYU IMAGES\\9780814770573.jpg]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap>The Tolerance Trap<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/the-tolerance-trap><br><br>How God, Genes, and Good Intentions are Sabotaging Gay Equality<br>Suzanna Danuta Walters<br><br>"Whether you are lesbian, gay or straight, Suzanna Walters's new book should make you wonder how the once kick-ass gay rights movement became so meek and humble. [...] The Tolerance Trap serves as a cautionary tale in a climate in which the majority of spokespeople for LGBT rights are mired in appeasement and assimilation, meekly asking to be accepted rather than demanding equality and respect. There has been a shift from angry radicalism to [...] Beryl Nicholson 2014-08-14T09:43:30+01:00 2014-08-14T09:43:30+01:00 Fw: [Whnlist] Angelou Centre\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds New Heritage Project & Regional (North East England) Job Opportunity https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;f77f630d.1408 On Tuesday, 12 August 2014, 8:45, Debi Withers <debiwithers@yahoo.co.uk> wrote: Please circulate to networks and interested parties.... The Angelou Centre has been awarded HLF funding to deliver the BAM! Sistahood! Projectand are excited to not only announce the start of the project but also a new job opportunity co-ordinating the project regionally. The BAM! Sistahood! Project is an intergenerational project that will focus on the cultural, social and political heritage of four generations of Black, Asian, Minority Ethnic and Refugee (BAMER) women in the North East of England. The project aims to engage these diverse and underrepresented communities in the [...] Hannah Bows 2014-07-15T13:41:12+01:00 2014-07-15T13:41:12+01:00 CFP: Transformative Feminist Methods Conference 10th September 2014 Durham University https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;2df7a12a.1407 Apologies for x-posting. Please note the deadline for submissions has been extended to July 31 2014.<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Hannah<br><br>Transformative Feminist Methods Conference<br><br>10th September 2014, Durham University, UK.<br><br>Keynote: Professor Sandra Harding, University of California.<br><br>In 1986 Sandra Harding\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds The Science Question in Feminism questioned whether the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdgold standard\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd scientific method was capable of producing knowledge not tainted by sexism and ethnocentrism. Harding argued for a feminist standpoint theory, which privileged the voices and lives of marginalized subject/agents of knowledge, to generate knowledge about society capable of transforming society and academia. Over the past 30 years feminist methods have continued [...] Alison Stenning 2014-05-19T15:21:09+00:00 2014-05-19T15:21:09+00:00 Re: Event: Make Newcastle a slave free zone Tuesday 20th May 3-5 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;785c5605.1405 A final reminder of this event tomorrow - please do come along.<br>Alison<br><br>A couple of updates on previous communications - confirmed panelists include Pete Nelson from West Yorkshire Police and Dr Alison Jobe, Durham University.<br><br>Please do come along to this, and pass on the information to others who might be interested. [...] Charles Woodhead 2014-05-14T13:35:49+00:00 2014-05-14T13:35:49+00:00 491 Days - Winnie Madikizela-Mandela https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;8991fe79.1405 [Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\covers\\large\\9780821421017.jpg]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/38316-491-days.html>491 Days<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/38316-491-days.html><br><br>Prisoner Number 1323/69<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/38316-491-days.html><br>Winnie Madikizela-Mandela & Foreword by Ahmed Kathrada<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/38316-491-days.html><br>"Winnie Madikizela-Mandela's more recent years have left her image tainted. But in her new book, a collection of letters and diary entries from her 491 days in prison, is a powerful reminder of what she was best known for. ... These give a gripping insight into a family trying to survive under an onslaught from the regime. But in the journal and the letters, the couple's fierce resistance burns through."-Mail & Guardian, South Africa<br>"In 1969, five years after Nelson Mandela was sentenced to life imprisonment [...] Alison Stenning 2014-05-07T13:05:27+00:00 2014-05-07T13:05:27+00:00 FW: Event: Make Newcastle a slave free zone Tuesday 20th May 3-5 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CGWS;7be7d4f7.1405 A couple of updates on previous communications - confirmed panelists include Pete Nelson from West Yorkshire Police and Dr Alison Jobe, Durham University.<br><br>Please do come along to this, and pass on the information to others who might be interested.<br><br>Thanks,<br>Alison Stenning<br><br>Make Newcastle a slave free zone<br>Film screening and panel discussion<br>Tuesday 20th May, 3-5pm<br>Room 1.29, Daysh Building, Newcastle Upon Tyne, Claremont Road, NE1 7RU [...]
